1045  //============================================================================
1046  // Method Description:
1058  template<typename dtype>
1059  bool allclose(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, double inTolerance)
1060  {
1061  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
1062  {
1063  std::string errStr = "ERROR: allclose: input array dimensions are not consistant.";
1064  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1065  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1066  }
1067 
1068  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray1.size(); ++i)
1069  {
1070  if (std::abs(inArray1[i] - inArray2[i]) > inTolerance)
1071  {
1072  return false;
1073  }
1074  }
1075 
1076  return true;
1077  }

1161  //============================================================================
1162  // Method Description:
1175  template<typename dtype>
1176  NdArray<dtype> append(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inAppendValues, Axis inAxis)
1177  {
1178  switch (inAxis)
1179  {
1180  case Axis::NONE:
1181  {
1182  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() + inAppendValues.size());
1183  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1184  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1185 
1186  return returnArray;
1187  }
1188  case Axis::ROW:
1189  {
1190  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1191  const Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1192  if (inShape.cols != appendShape.cols)
1193  {
1194  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1195  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1196  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1197  }
1198 
1199  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows + appendShape.rows, inShape.cols);
1200  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1201  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1202 
1203  return returnArray;
1204  }
1205  case Axis::COL:
1206  {
1207  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1208  const Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1209  if (inShape.rows != appendShape.rows)
1210  {
1211  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1212  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1213  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1214  }
1215 
1216  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols + appendShape.cols);
1217  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
1218  {
1219  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row));
1220  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(row), inAppendValues.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row) + inShape.cols);
1221  }
1222 
1223  return returnArray;
1224  }
1225  default:
1226  {
1227  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1228  // of the compiler warning.
1229  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
1230  }
1231  }
1232  }
1233 
1234  //============================================================================
1235  // Method Description:
1254  template<typename dtype>
1255  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, dtype inStep)
1256  {
1257  if (inStep > 0 && inStop < inStart)
1258  {
1259  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must be larger than the start value for positive step.";
1260  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1261  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1262  }
1263 
1264  if (inStep < 0 && inStop > inStart)
1265  {
1266  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: start value must be larger than the stop value for negative step.";
1267  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1268  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1269  }
1270 
1271  std::vector<dtype> values;
1272 
1273  dtype theValue = inStart;
1274 
1275  if (inStep > 0)
1276  {
1277  while (theValue < inStop)
1278  {
1279  values.push_back(theValue);
1280  theValue += inStep;
1281  }
1282  }
1283  else
1284  {
1285  while (theValue > inStop)
1286  {
1287  values.push_back(theValue);
1288  theValue += inStep;
1289  }
1290  }
1291 
1292  return NdArray<dtype>(values);
1293  }
1294 
1295  //============================================================================
1296  // Method Description:
1314  template<typename dtype>
1315  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStop)
1316  {
1317  if (inStop <= 0)
1318  {
1319  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must ge greater than 0.";
1320  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1321  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1322  }
1323 
1324  return arange<dtype>(0, inStop, 1);
1325  }
1326

1328 // Method Description:
1346  template<typename dtype>
1347  NdArray<dtype> arange(const Slice& inSlice)
1348  {
1349  return arange<dtype>(inSlice.start, inSlice.stop, inSlice.step);
1350  }

1369  //============================================================================
1370  // Method Description:
1380  template<typename dtype>
1381  NdArray<double> arccos(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray) noexcept

1843  //============================================================================
1844  // Method Description:
1855  template<typename dtype>
1856  NdArray<double> average(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, Axis inAxis)
1857  {
1858  switch (inAxis)
1859  {
1860  case Axis::NONE:
1861  {
1862  if (inWeights.shape() != inArray.shape())
1863  {
1864  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1865  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1866  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1867  }
1868 
1869  NdArray<double> weightedArray(inArray.shape());
1870  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), inWeights.cbegin(),
1871  weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1872 
1873  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1874  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= inWeights.template sum<double>().item() };
1875 
1876  return returnArray;
1877  }
1878  case Axis::COL:
1879  {
1880  const Shape arrayShape = inArray.shape();
1881  if (inWeights.size() != arrayShape.cols)
1882  {
1883  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weights value are not consistant.";
1884  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1885  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1886  }
1887 
1888  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1889  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, arrayShape.rows);
1890  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
1891  {
1892  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, arrayShape.cols);
1893  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(),
1894  weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1895 
1896  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1897  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1898  }
1899 
1900  return returnArray;
1901  }
1902  case Axis::ROW:
1903  {
1904  if (inWeights.size() != inArray.shape().rows)
1905  {
1906  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1907  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1908  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1909  }
1910 
1911  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
1912 
1913  const Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
1914  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1915  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
1916  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
1917  {
1918  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, transShape.cols);
1919  std::transform(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(),
1920  weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1921 
1922  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1923  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1924  }
1925 
1926  return returnArray;
1927  }
1928  default:
1929  {
1930  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1931  // of the compiler warning.
1932  return NdArray<double>(0);
1933  }
1934  }
1935  }

1953  //============================================================================
1954  // Method Description:
1971  template<typename dtype>
1972  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint16 inMinLength)
1973  {
1974  // only works with integer input types
1975  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1976 
1977  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1978  if (maxValue < 0)
1979  {
1980  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1981  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
1982  }
1983 
1984  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1985  {
1986  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1987  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1988  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1989  }
1990 
1991  const uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1992  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1993 
1994  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1995  outArray.zeros();
1996  for (auto value : clippedArray)
1997  {
1998  ++outArray[value];
1999  }
2000 
2001  return outArray;
2002  }
2003 
2004  //============================================================================
2005  // Method Description:
2025  template<typename dtype>
2026  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, uint16 inMinLength)
2027  {
2028  // only works with integer input types
2029  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
2030 
2031  if (inArray.shape() != inWeights.shape())
2032  {
2033  std::string errStr = "ERROR: bincount: weights array must be the same shape as the input array.";
2034  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2035  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2036  }
2037 
2038  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
2039  if (maxValue < 0)
2040  {
2041  // no positive values so just return an empty array
2042  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
2043  }
2044 
2045  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
2046  {
2047  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
2048  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2049  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2050  }
2051 
2052  const uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
2053  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
2054 
2055  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
2056  outArray.zeros();
2057  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2058  {
2059  outArray[clippedArray[i]] += inWeights[i];
2060  }
2061 
2062  return outArray;
2063  }

2257  //============================================================================
2258  // Method Description:
2268  template<typename dtype>
2269  NdArray<dtype> column_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
2270  {
2271  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
2272  Shape finalShape;
2273  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
2274  {
2275  if (finalShape.isnull())
2276  {
2277  finalShape = ndarray.shape();
2278  }
2279  else if (ndarray.shape().rows != finalShape.rows)
2280  {
2281  std::string errStr = "ERROR: column_stack: input arrays must have the same number of rows.";
2282  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2283  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2284  }
2285  else
2286  {
2287  finalShape.cols += ndarray.shape().cols;
2288  }
2289  }
2290 
2291  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
2292  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
2293  uint32 colStart = 0;
2294  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
2295  {
2296  const Shape theShape = ndarray.shape();
2297  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
2298  {
2299  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
2300  {
2301  returnArray(row, colStart + col) = ndarray(row, col);
2302  }
2303  }
2304  colStart += theShape.cols;
2305  }
2306 
2307  return returnArray;
2308  }
2309 
2310  //============================================================================
2311  // Method Description:
2321  template<typename dtype>
2322  NdArray<dtype> concatenate(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList, Axis inAxis)
2323  {
2324  switch (inAxis)
2325  {
2326  case Axis::NONE:
2327  {
2328  uint32 finalSize = 0;
2329  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
2330  {
2331  finalSize += ndarray.size();
2332  }
2333 
2334  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, finalSize);
2335  uint32 offset = 0;
2336  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
2337  {
2338  std::copy(ndarray.cbegin(), ndarray.cend(), returnArray.begin() + offset);
2339  offset += ndarray.size();
2340  }
2341 
2342  return returnArray;
2343  }
2344  case Axis::ROW:
2345  {
2346  return row_stack(inArrayList);
2347  }
2348  case Axis::COL:
2349  {
2350  return column_stack(inArrayList);
2351  }
2352  default:
2353  {
2354  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2355  // of the compiler warning.
2356  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
2357  }
2358  }
2359  }

2508  {
2509  NdArray<double> returnArray(inArray.shape());
2510  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin(),
2511  [](dtype inValue) noexcept -> double { return std::cosh(static_cast<double>(inValue)); });
2512 
2513  return returnArray;
2514  }

2516  //============================================================================
2517  // Method Description:
2527  template<typename dtype>
2528  NdArray<uint32> count_nonzero(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
2529  {
2530  switch (inAxis)
2531  {
2532  case Axis::NONE:
2533  {
2534  NdArray<uint32> count = { inArray.size() - static_cast<uint32>(std::count(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), static_cast<dtype>(0))) };
2535  return count;
2536  }
2537  case Axis::COL:
2538  {
2539  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2540 
2541  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
2542  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2543  {
2544  returnArray(0, row) = inShape.cols -
2545  static_cast<uint32>(std::count(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), static_cast<dtype>(0)));
2546  }
2547 
2548  return returnArray;
2549  }
2550  case Axis::ROW:
2551  {
2552  NdArray<dtype> inArrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
2553  Shape inShapeTransposed = inArrayTranspose.shape();
2554  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShapeTransposed.rows);
2555  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeTransposed.rows; ++row)
2556  {
2557  returnArray(0, row) = inShapeTransposed.cols -
2558  static_cast<uint32>(std::count(inArrayTranspose.cbegin(row), inArrayTranspose.cend(row), static_cast<dtype>(0)));
2559  }
2560 
2561  return returnArray;
2562  }
2563  default:
2564  {
2565  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2566  // of the compiler warning.
2567  return NdArray<uint32>(0);
2568  }
2569  }
2570  }

2572  //============================================================================
2573  // Method Description:
2584  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
2585  NdArray<dtypeOut> cross(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, Axis inAxis)
2586  {
2587  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
2588  {
2589  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: the input array dimensions are not consistant.";
2590  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2591  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2592  }
2593 
2594  switch (inAxis)
2595  {
2596  case Axis::NONE:
2597  {
2598  const uint32 arraySize = inArray1.size();
2599  if (arraySize != inArray2.size() || arraySize < 2 || arraySize > 3)
2600  {
2601  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2602  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2603  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2604  }
2605 
2606  NdArray<dtype> in1 = inArray1.flatten();
2607  NdArray<dtype> in2 = inArray2.flatten();
2608 
2609  switch (arraySize)
2610  {
2611  case 2:
2612  {
2613  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2614  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]) };
2615  return returnArray;
2616  }
2617  case 3:
2618  {
2619  dtypeOut i = static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2620  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1]);
2621  dtypeOut j = -(static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2622  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2623  dtypeOut k = (static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2624  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2625 
2626  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { i, j, k };
2627  return returnArray;
2628  }
2629  default:
2630  {
2631  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2632  // of the compiler warning.
2633  return NdArray<dtypeOut>(0);
2634  }
2635  }
2636  }
2637  case Axis::ROW:
2638  {
2639  const Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2640  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.rows < 2 || arrayShape.rows > 3)
2641  {
2642  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2643  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2644  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2645  }
2646 
2647  Shape returnArrayShape;
2648  if (arrayShape.rows == 2)
2649  {
2650  returnArrayShape = Shape(1, arrayShape.cols);
2651  }
2652  else
2653  {
2654  returnArrayShape = Shape(3, arrayShape.cols);
2655  }
2656 
2657  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2658  for (uint32 col = 0; col < arrayShape.cols; ++col)
2659  {
2660  const int32 theCol = static_cast<int32>(col);
2661  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2662  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2663  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2664 
2665  returnArray.put({ 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 }, vecCross);
2666  }
2667 
2668  return returnArray;
2669  }
2670  case Axis::COL:
2671  {
2672  const Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2673  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.cols < 2 || arrayShape.cols > 3)
2674  {
2675  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2676  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2677  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2678  }
2679 
2680  Shape returnArrayShape;
2681  if (arrayShape.cols == 2)
2682  {
2683  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 1);
2684  }
2685  else
2686  {
2687  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 3);
2688  }
2689 
2690  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2691  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
2692  {
2693  const int32 theRow = static_cast<int32>(row);
2694  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2695  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2696  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2697 
2698  returnArray.put({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.cols) }, vecCross);
2699  }
2700 
2701  return returnArray;
2702  }
2703  default:
2704  {
2705  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2706  // of the compiler warning.
2707  return NdArray<dtypeOut>(0);
2708  }
2709  }
2710  }

2852  //============================================================================
2853  // Method Description:
2862  template<typename dtype>
2863  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<uint32>& inArrayIdxs, Axis inAxis)
2864  {
2865  // make sure that the indices are unique first
2866  NdArray<uint32> indices = unique(inArrayIdxs);
2867 
2868  switch (inAxis)
2869  {
2870  case Axis::NONE:
2871  {
2872  std::vector<dtype> values;
2873  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2874  {
2875  if (indices.contains(i).item())
2876  {
2877  continue;
2878  }
2879 
2880  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
2881  }
2882 
2883  return NdArray<dtype>(values);
2884  }
2885  case Axis::ROW:
2886  {
2887  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2888  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.rows)
2889  {
2890  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of rows in the array.";
2891  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2892  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2893  }
2894 
2895  const uint32 numNewRows = inShape.rows - indices.size();
2896  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(numNewRows, inShape.cols);
2897 
2898  uint32 rowCounter = 0;
2899  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2900  {
2901  if (indices.contains(row).item())
2902  {
2903  continue;
2904  }
2905 
2906  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2907  {
2908  returnArray(rowCounter, col) = inArray(row, col);
2909  }
2910  ++rowCounter;
2911  }
2912 
2913  return returnArray;
2914  }
2915  case Axis::COL:
2916  {
2917  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2918  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.cols)
2919  {
2920  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of cols in the array.";
2921  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2922  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2923  }
2924 
2925  const uint32 numNewCols = inShape.cols - indices.size();
2926  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, numNewCols);
2927 
2928  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2929  {
2930  uint32 colCounter = 0;
2931  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2932  {
2933  if (indices.contains(col).item())
2934  {
2935  continue;
2936  }
2937 
2938  returnArray(row, colCounter++) = inArray(row, col);
2939  }
2940  }
2941 
2942  return returnArray;
2943 
2944 
2945  }
2946  default:
2947  {
2948  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2949  // of the compiler warning.
2950  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
2951  }
2952  }
2953  }
2954 
2955  //============================================================================
2956  // Method Description:
2965  template<typename dtype>
2966  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const Slice& inIndicesSlice, Axis inAxis)
2967  {
2968  Slice sliceCopy(inIndicesSlice);
2969 
2970  switch (inAxis)
2971  {
2972  case Axis::NONE:
2973  {
2974  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.size());
2975  break;
2976  }
2977  case Axis::ROW:
2978  {
2979  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().cols);
2980  break;
2981  }
2982  case Axis::COL:
2983  {
2984  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().rows);
2985  break;
2986  }
2987  }
2988 
2989  std::vector<uint32> indices;
2990  for (uint32 i = static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.start); i < static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.stop); i += sliceCopy.step)
2991  {
2992  indices.push_back(i);
2993  }
2994 
2995  return deleteIndices(inArray, NdArray<uint32>(indices), inAxis);
2996  }

3010  {
3011  NdArray<uint32> inIndices = { inIndex };
3012  return deleteIndices(inArray, inIndices, inAxis);
3013  }

3057  //============================================================================
3058  // Method Description:
3069  template<typename dtype>
3070  NdArray<dtype> diff(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
3071  {
3072  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
3073 
3074  switch (inAxis)
3075  {
3076  case Axis::NONE:
3077  {
3078  if (inArray.size() < 2)
3079  {
3080  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
3081  }
3082 
3083  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - 1);
3084  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend() - 1, inArray.cbegin() + 1, returnArray.begin(),
3085  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3086 
3087  return returnArray;
3088  }
3089  case Axis::COL:
3090  {
3091  if (inShape.cols < 2)
3092  {
3093  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
3094  }
3095 
3096  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols - 1);
3097  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
3098  {
3099  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row) - 1, inArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3100  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3101  }
3102 
3103  return returnArray;
3104  }
3105  case Axis::ROW:
3106  {
3107  if (inShape.rows < 2)
3108  {
3109  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
3110  }
3111 
3112  NdArray<dtype> transArray = inArray.transpose();
3113  const Shape transShape = transArray.shape();
3114  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(transShape.rows, transShape.cols - 1);
3115  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
3116  {
3117  std::transform(transArray.cbegin(row), transArray.cend(row) - 1, transArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3118  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3119  }
3120 
3121  return returnArray.transpose();
3122  }
3123  default:
3124  {
3125  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
3126  // of the compiler warning.
3127  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
3128  }
3129  }
3130  }

3488  template<typename dtype>
3489  NdArray<dtype> eye(uint32 inN, uint32 inM, int32 inK) noexcept
3490  {
3491  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN, inM);
3492  returnArray.zeros();
3493 
3494  if (inK < 0)
3495  {
3496  uint32 col = 0;
3497  for (uint32 row = inK; row < inN; ++row)
3498  {
3499  if (col >= inM)
3500  {
3501  break;
3502  }
3503 
3504  returnArray(row, col++) = 1;
3505  }
3506  }
3507  else
3508  {
3509  uint32 row = 0;
3510  for (uint32 col = inK; col < inM; ++col)
3511  {
3512  if (row >= inN)
3513  {
3514  break;
3515  }
3516 
3517  returnArray(row++, col) = 1;
3518  }
3519  }
3520 
3521  return returnArray;
3522  }

3663  // Method Description:
3673  template<typename dtype>
3674  NdArray<dtype> flip(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
3675  {
3676  switch (inAxis)
3677  {
3678  case Axis::NONE:
3679  {
3680  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3681  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.end());
3682  return returnArray;
3683  }
3684  case Axis::COL:
3685  {
3686  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3687  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3688  {
3689  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3690  }
3691  return returnArray;
3692  }
3693  case Axis::ROW:
3694  {
3695  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
3696  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3697  {
3698  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3699  }
3700  return returnArray.transpose();
3701  }
3702  default:
3703  {
3704  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
3705  }
3706  }
3707  }

3991  //============================================================================
3992  // Method Description:
4004  template<typename dtype>
4005  NdArray<dtype> fromfile(const std::string& inFilename, const std::string& inSep)
4006  {
4007  boost::filesystem::path p(inFilename);
4008  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(inFilename))
4009  {
4010  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: input filename does not exist.\n\t" + inFilename;
4011  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4012  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4013  }
4014 
4015  if (inSep.compare("") == 0)
4016  {
4017  // read in as binary file
4018  std::ifstream in(inFilename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
4019  in.seekg(0, in.end);
4020  const uint32 fileSize = static_cast<uint32>(in.tellg());
4021 
4022  FILE* filePtr = fopen(inFilename.c_str(), "rb");
4023  if (filePtr == nullptr)
4024  {
4025  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open the file.";
4026  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4027  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4028  }
4029 
4030  char* fileBuffer = new char[fileSize];
4031  const size_t bytesRead = fread(fileBuffer, sizeof(char), fileSize, filePtr);
4032  fclose(filePtr);
4033 
4034  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(reinterpret_cast<dtype*>(fileBuffer), static_cast<uint32>(bytesRead));
4035  delete[] fileBuffer;
4036 
4037  return returnArray;
4038  }
4039  else
4040  {
4041  // read in as txt file
4042  if (!(inSep.compare(" ") == 0 || inSep.compare("\t") == 0 || inSep.compare("\n") == 0))
4043  {
4044  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: only [' ', '\\t', '\\n'] seperators are supported";
4045  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4046  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4047  }
4048 
4049  std::vector<dtype> values;
4050 
4051  std::ifstream file(inFilename.c_str());
4052  if (file.is_open())
4053  {
4054  while (!file.eof())
4055  {
4056  std::string line;
4057  std::getline(file, line);
4058 
4059  std::istringstream iss(line);
4060  try
4061  {
4062  values.push_back(static_cast<dtype>(std::stod(iss.str())));
4063  }
4064  catch (const std::invalid_argument& ia)
4065  {
4066  std::cout << "Warning: fromfile: " << ia.what() << std::endl;
4068  }
4069  }
4070  file.close();
4071  }
4072  else
4073  {
4074  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open file.";
4075  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4076  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4077  }
4078 
4079  return NdArray<dtype>(values);
4080  }
4081  }

4214  //============================================================================
4215  // Method Description:
4226  template<typename dtype>
4227  NdArray<double> gradient(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
4228  {
4229  switch (inAxis)
4230  {
4231  case Axis::ROW:
4232  {
4233  const auto inShape = inArray.shape();
4234  if (inShape.rows < 2)
4235  {
4236  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 row.";
4237  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4238  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4239  }
4240 
4241  // first do the first and last rows
4242  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(inShape);
4243  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
4244  {
4245  returnArray(0, col) = static_cast<double>(inArray(1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(0, col));
4246  returnArray(-1, col) = static_cast<double>(inArray(-1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(-2, col));
4247  }
4248 
4249  // then rip through the rest of the array
4250  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
4251  {
4252  for (uint32 row = 1; row < inShape.rows - 1; ++row)
4253  {
4254  returnArray(row, col) = (static_cast<double>(inArray(row + 1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row - 1, col))) / 2.0;
4255  }
4256  }
4257 
4258  return returnArray;
4259  }
4260  case Axis::COL:
4261  {
4262  const auto inShape = inArray.shape();
4263  if (inShape.cols < 2)
4264  {
4265  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 columns.";
4266  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4267  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4268  }
4269 
4270  // first do the first and last columns
4271  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(inShape);
4272  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
4273  {
4274  returnArray(row, 0) = static_cast<double>(inArray(row, 1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, 0));
4275  returnArray(row, -1) = static_cast<double>(inArray(row, -1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, -2));
4276  }
4277 
4278  // then rip through the rest of the array
4279  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
4280  {
4281  for (uint32 col = 1; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
4282  {
4283  returnArray(row, col) = (static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col - 1))) / 2.0;
4284  }
4285  }
4286 
4287  return returnArray;
4288  }
4289  default:
4290  {
4291  // will return the gradient of the flattened array
4292  if (inArray.size() < 2)
4293  {
4294  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 element.";
4295  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4296  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4297  }
4298 
4299  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(1, inArray.size());
4300  returnArray[0] = static_cast<double>(inArray[1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[0]);
4301  returnArray[-1] = static_cast<double>(inArray[-1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[-2]);
4302 
4303  std::transform(inArray.cbegin() + 2, inArray.cend(), inArray.cbegin(), returnArray.begin() + 1,
4304  [](dtype value1, dtype value2) noexcept -> double { return (static_cast<double>(value1) - static_cast<double>(value2)) / 2.0; });
4305 
4306  return returnArray;
4307  }
4308  }
4309  }

4347  //============================================================================
4348  // Method Description:
4360  template<typename dtype>
4361  std::pair<NdArray<uint32>, NdArray<double> > histogram(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inNumBins)
4362  {
4363  if (inNumBins == 0)
4364  {
4365  std::string errStr = "ERROR: histogram: number of bins must be positive.";
4366  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4367  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4368  }
4369 
4370  NdArray<uint32> histo = zeros<uint32>(1, inNumBins);
4371 
4372  const bool useEndPoint = true;
4373  NdArray<double> binEdges = linspace(static_cast<double>(inArray.min().item()),
4374  static_cast<double>(inArray.max().item()), inNumBins + 1, useEndPoint);
4375 
4376  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
4377  {
4378  // binary search to find the bin idx
4379  const bool keepSearching = true;
4380  uint32 lowIdx = 0;
4381  uint32 highIdx = binEdges.size() - 1;
4382  while (keepSearching)
4383  {
4384  const uint32 idx = (lowIdx + highIdx) / 2; // integer division
4385  if (lowIdx == highIdx || lowIdx == highIdx - 1)
4386  {
4387  // we found the bin
4388  ++histo[lowIdx];
4389  break;
4390  }
4391 
4392  if (inArray[i] > binEdges[idx])
4393  {
4394  lowIdx = idx;
4395  }
4396  else if (inArray[i] < binEdges[idx])
4397  {
4398  highIdx = idx;
4399  }
4400  else
4401  {
4402  // we found the bin
4403  ++histo[idx];
4404  break;
4405  }
4406  }
4407  }
4408 
4409  return std::make_pair(histo, binEdges);
4410  }

4523  double interp(dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2, double inPercent) noexcept
4524  {
4525  return utils::interp(inValue1, inValue2, inPercent);
4526  }

4528  //============================================================================
4529  // Method Description:
4546  template<typename dtype>
4547  NdArray<dtype> interp(const NdArray<dtype>& inX, const NdArray<dtype>& inXp, const NdArray<dtype>& inFp)
4548  {
4549  // do some error checking first
4550  if (inXp.size() != inFp.size())
4551  {
4552  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: inXp and inFp need to be the same size().";
4553  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4554  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4555  }
4556 
4557  if (inX.min().item() < inXp.min().item() || inX.max().item() > inXp.max().item())
4558  {
4559  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: endpoints of inX should be contained within inXp.";
4560  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4561  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4562  }
4563 
4564  // sort the input inXp and inFp data
4565  NdArray<uint32> sortedXpIdxs = argsort(inXp);
4566  NdArray<dtype> sortedXp(1, inFp.size());
4567  NdArray<dtype> sortedFp(1, inFp.size());
4568  uint32 counter = 0;
4569  for (auto sortedXpIdx : sortedXpIdxs)
4570  {
4571  sortedXp[counter] = inXp[sortedXpIdx];
4572  sortedFp[counter++] = inFp[sortedXpIdx];
4573  }
4574 
4575  // sort the input inX array
4576  NdArray<dtype> sortedX = sort(inX);
4577 
4578  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inX.size());
4579 
4580  uint32 currXpIdx = 0;
4581  uint32 currXidx = 0;
4582  while (currXidx < sortedX.size())
4583  {
4584  if (sortedXp[currXpIdx] <= sortedX[currXidx] && sortedX[currXidx] <= sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1])
4585  {
4586  const double percent = static_cast<double>(sortedX[currXidx] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]) /
4587  static_cast<double>(sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]);
4588  returnArray[currXidx++] = utils::interp(sortedFp[currXpIdx], sortedFp[currXpIdx + 1], percent);
4589  }
4590  else
4591  {
4592  ++currXpIdx;
4593  }
4594  }
4595 
4596  return returnArray;
4597  }
4598 
4599  //============================================================================
4600  // Method Description:
4613  template<typename dtype>
4614  NdArray<dtype> intersect1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
4615  {
4616  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
4617  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
4618  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
4619 
4620  const typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_intersection(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
4621  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
4622  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
4623  return NdArray<dtype>(res);
4624  }

4664  {

4666  {

4674  [inRtol, inAtol](dtype inValueA, dtype inValueB) noexcept -> bool
4675  { return std::abs(inValueA - inValueB) <= (inAtol + inRtol * std::abs(inValueB)); });
4676

4900  //============================================================================
4901  // Method Description:
4922  template<typename dtype>
4923  NdArray<dtype> linspace(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, uint32 inNum, bool endPoint)
4924  {
4925  if (inNum == 0)
4926  {
4927  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
4928  }
4929  else if (inNum == 1)
4930  {
4931  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart };
4932  return returnArray;
4933  }
4934 
4935  if (inStop <= inStart)
4936  {
4937  std::string errStr = "ERROR: linspace: stop value must be greater than the start value.";
4938  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4939  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4940  }
4941 
4942  if (endPoint)
4943  {
4944  if (inNum == 2)
4945  {
4946  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStop };
4947  return returnArray;
4948  }
4949  else
4950  {
4951  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4952  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4953  returnArray[inNum - 1] = inStop;
4954 
4955  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum - 1);
4956  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum - 1; ++i)
4957  {
4958  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4959  }
4960 
4961  return returnArray;
4962  }
4963  }
4964  else
4965  {
4966  if (inNum == 2)
4967  {
4968  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum);
4969  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStart + step };
4970  return returnArray;
4971  }
4972  else
4973  {
4974  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4975  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4976 
4977  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / inNum;
4978  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum; ++i)
4979  {
4980  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4981  }
4982 
4983  return returnArray;
4984  }
4985  }
4986  }

5380  // Method Description:
5394  template<typename dtype>
5395  std::pair<NdArray<dtype>, NdArray<dtype> > meshgrid(const NdArray<dtype>& inICoords, const NdArray<dtype>& inJCoords) noexcept
5396  {
5397  const uint32 numRows = inJCoords.size();
5398  const uint32 numCols = inICoords.size();
5399  auto returnArrayI = NdArray<dtype>(numRows, numCols);
5400  auto returnArrayJ = NdArray<dtype>(numRows, numCols);
5401 
5402  // first the I array
5403  for (uint32 row = 0; row < numRows; ++row)
5404  {
5405  for (uint32 col = 0; col < numCols; ++col)
5406  {
5407  returnArrayI(row, col) = inICoords[col];
5408  }
5409  }
5410 
5411  // then the I array
5412  for (uint32 col = 0; col < numCols; ++col)
5413  {
5414  for (uint32 row = 0; row < numRows; ++row)
5415  {
5416  returnArrayJ(row, col) = inJCoords[row];
5417  }
5418  }
5419 
5420  return std::make_pair(returnArrayI, returnArrayJ);
5421  }

5613  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5614  NdArray<dtypeOut> nancumsum(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept

5620  {
5621  value = 0;
5622  }
5623  }
5624

5656  // Method Description:
5667  template<typename dtype>
5668  NdArray<double> nanmean(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
5669  {
5670  switch (inAxis)
5671  {
5672  case Axis::NONE:
5673  {
5674  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5675  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5676 
5677  const double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5678  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5679 
5680  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= numberNonNan };
5681 
5682  return returnArray;
5683  }
5684  case Axis::COL:
5685  {
5686  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5687  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5688  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5689  {
5690  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5691  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5692 
5693  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5694  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5695 
5696  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5697  }
5698 
5699  return returnArray;
5700  }
5701  case Axis::ROW:
5702  {
5703  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5704  const Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
5705  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
5706  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
5707  {
5708  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5709  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5710 
5711  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5712  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) noexcept -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5713 
5714  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5715  }
5716 
5717  return returnArray;
5718  }
5719  default:
5720  {
5721  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5722  // of the compiler warning.
5723  return NdArray<double>(0);
5724  }
5725  }
5726  }
5727

5729  // Method Description:
5740  template<typename dtype>
5741  NdArray<dtype> nanmedian(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
5742  {
5743  switch (inAxis)
5744  {
5745  case Axis::NONE:
5746  {
5747  std::vector<dtype> values;
5748  for (auto value : inArray)
5749  {
5750  if (!std::isnan(value))
5751  {
5752  values.push_back(value);
5753  }
5754  }
5755 
5756  const uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5757  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5758  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { values[middle] };
5759 
5760  return returnArray;
5761  }
5762  case Axis::COL:
5763  {
5764  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5765  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5766  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5767  {
5768  std::vector<dtype> values;
5769  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5770  {
5771  if (!std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5772  {
5773  values.push_back(inArray(row, col));
5774  }
5775  }
5776 
5777  const uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5778  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5779  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5780  }
5781 
5782  return returnArray;
5783  }
5784  case Axis::ROW:
5785  {
5786  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5787  const Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5788  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5789  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5790  {
5791  std::vector<dtype> values;
5792  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5793  {
5794  if (!std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5795  {
5796  values.push_back(transposedArray(row, col));
5797  }
5798  }
5799 
5800  const uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5801  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5802  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5803  }
5804 
5805  return returnArray;
5806  }
5807  default:
5808  {
5809  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5810  // of the compiler warning.
5811  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
5812  }
5813  }
5814  }

5828  template<typename dtype>
5829  NdArray<dtype> nanmin(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
5830  {
5831  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5832  for (auto& value : arrayCopy)
5833  {
5834  if (std::isnan(value))
5835  {
5836  value = DtypeInfo<dtype>::max();

5841  }

5843  //============================================================================
5844  // Method Description:
5856  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5857  NdArray<double> nanpercentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile,
5858  Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5859  {
5860  if (inPercentile < 0.0 || inPercentile > 100.0)
5861  {
5862  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5863  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5864  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5865  }
5866 
5867  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5868  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5869  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5870  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5871  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5872  {
5873  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5874  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5875  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5876  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5877  }
5878 
5879  switch (inAxis)
5880  {
5881  case Axis::NONE:
5882  {
5883  if (utils::essentiallyEqual(inPercentile, 0.0))
5884  {
5885  for (auto value : inArray)
5886  {
5887  if (!isnan(value))
5888  {
5889  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(value) };
5890  return returnArray;
5891  }
5892  }
5893  return NdArray<dtypeOut>(0);
5894  }
5895  else if (utils::essentiallyEqual(inPercentile, 100.0))
5896  {
5897  for (int32 i = static_cast<int32>(inArray.size()) - 1; i > -1; --i)
5898  {
5899  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5900  {
5901  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5902  return returnArray;
5903  }
5904  }
5905  return NdArray<dtypeOut>(0);
5906  }
5907 
5908  std::vector<double> arrayCopy;
5909  uint32 numNonNan = 0;
5910  for (auto value : inArray)
5911  {
5912  if (!isnan(value))
5913  {
5914  arrayCopy.push_back(value);
5915  ++numNonNan;
5916  }
5917  }
5918 
5919  if (arrayCopy.size() < 2)
5920  {
5921  return NdArray<dtypeOut>(0);
5922  }
5923 
5924  const int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5925  const uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, numNonNan - 2));
5926 
5927  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5928 
5929  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
5930  {
5931  const double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5932  const double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
5933  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) - percentI);
5934 
5935  const double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
5936  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
5937  return returnArray;
5938  }
5939  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
5940  {
5941  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5942  return returnArray;
5943  }
5944  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
5945  {
5946  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5947  return returnArray;
5948  }
5949  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
5950  {
5951  const double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
5952  const double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5953  const double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5954  const double diff1 = percent - percent1;
5955  const double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
5956 
5957  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
5958  {
5959  case 0:
5960  {
5961  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5962  return returnArray;
5963  }
5964  case 1:
5965  {
5966  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5967  return returnArray;
5968  }
5969  }
5970  }
5971  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
5972  {
5973  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { (arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0 };
5974  return returnArray;
5975  }
5976  }
5977  case Axis::COL:
5978  {
5979  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5980 
5981  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5982  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5983  {
5984  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
5985  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5986 
5987  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5988  {
5989  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5990  }
5991  else
5992  {
5993  returnArray[row] = constants::nan;
5994  }
5995  }
5996 
5997  return returnArray;
5998  }
5999  case Axis::ROW:
6000  {
6001  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6002  const Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6003 
6004  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6005  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6006  {
6007  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6008  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
6009 
6010  if (outValue.size() == 1)
6011  {
6012  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
6013  }
6014  else
6015  {
6016  returnArray[row] = constants::nan;
6017  }
6018  }
6019 
6020  return returnArray;
6021  }
6022  default:
6023  {
6024  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6025  // of the compiler warning.
6026  return NdArray<dtypeOut>(0);
6027  }
6028  }
6029  }
6030

6032  // Method Description:

6044  NdArray<dtypeOut> nanprod(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
6045  {
6046  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
6047  for (auto& value : arrayCopy)
6048  {
6049  if (std::isnan(value))
6050  {
6051  value = 1;
6052  }
6053  }
6054 
6055  return prod<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis);

6123  //============================================================================
6124  // Method Description:
6135  template<typename dtype>
6136  NdArray<double> nanstdev(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
6137  {
6138  switch (inAxis)
6139  {
6140  case Axis::NONE:
6141  {
6142  double meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis).item();
6143  double sum = 0;
6144  double counter = 0;
6145  for (auto value : inArray)
6146  {
6147  if (std::isnan(value))
6148  {
6149  continue;
6150  }
6151 
6152  sum += utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(value) - meanValue);
6153  ++counter;
6154  }
6155  NdArray<double> returnArray = { std::sqrt(sum / counter) };
6156  return returnArray;
6157  }
6158  case Axis::COL:
6159  {
6160  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6161  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
6162  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6163  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6164  {
6165  double sum = 0;
6166  double counter = 0;
6167  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
6168  {
6169  if (std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
6170  {
6171  continue;
6172  }
6173 
6174  sum += utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
6175  ++counter;
6176  }
6177  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
6178  }
6179 
6180  return returnArray;
6181  }
6182  case Axis::ROW:
6183  {
6184  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
6185  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
6186  const Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
6187  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6188  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6189  {
6190  double sum = 0;
6191  double counter = 0;
6192  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
6193  {
6194  if (std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
6195  {
6196  continue;
6197  }
6198 
6199  sum += utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(transposedArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
6200  ++counter;
6201  }
6202  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
6203  }
6204 
6205  return returnArray;
6206  }
6207  default:
6208  {
6209  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6210  // of the compiler warning.
6211  return NdArray<double>(0);
6212  }
6213  }
6214  }

6516  //============================================================================
6517  // Method Description:
6534  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6535  NdArray<dtypeOut> percentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile,
6536  Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
6537  {
6538  if (inPercentile < 0.0 || inPercentile > 100.0)
6539  {
6540  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
6541  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6542  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6543  }
6544 
6545  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
6546  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
6547  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
6548  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
6549  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
6550  {
6551  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
6552  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
6553  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6554  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6555  }
6556 
6557  switch (inAxis)
6558  {
6559  case Axis::NONE:
6560  {
6561  if (utils::essentiallyEqual(inPercentile, 0.0))
6562  {
6563  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cbegin()) };
6564  return returnArray;
6565  }
6566  else if (utils::essentiallyEqual(inPercentile, 100.0))
6567  {
6568  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cend()) };
6569  return returnArray;
6570  }
6571 
6572  const int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
6573  const uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, inArray.size() - 2));
6574 
6575  NdArray<double> arrayCopy = inArray.template astype<double>();
6576  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
6577 
6578  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
6579  {
6580  const double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6581  const double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
6582  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) - percentI);
6583 
6584  const double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
6585  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
6586  return returnArray;
6587  }
6588  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
6589  {
6590  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6591  return returnArray;
6592  }
6593  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
6594  {
6595  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6596  return returnArray;
6597  }
6598  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
6599  {
6600  const double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
6601  const double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6602  const double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6603  const double diff1 = percent - percent1;
6604  const double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
6605 
6606  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
6607  {
6608  case 0:
6609  {
6610  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6611  return returnArray;
6612  }
6613  case 1:
6614  {
6615  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6616  return returnArray;
6617  }
6618  }
6619  }
6620  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
6621  {
6622  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>((arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0) };
6623  return returnArray;
6624  }
6625  }
6626  case Axis::COL:
6627  {
6628  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6629 
6630  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6631  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6632  {
6633  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
6634  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6635  }
6636 
6637  return returnArray;
6638  }
6639  case Axis::ROW:
6640  {
6641  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6642  const Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6643 
6644  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6645  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6646  {
6647  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6648  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6649  }
6650 
6651  return returnArray;
6652  }
6653  default:
6654  {
6655  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6656  // of the compiler warning.
6657  return NdArray<dtypeOut>(0);
6658  }
6659  }
6660  }
6661

7298  //============================================================================
7299  // Method Description:
7311  template<typename dtype>
7312  NdArray<dtype> roll(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inShift, Axis inAxis) noexcept
7313  {
7314  switch (inAxis)
7315  {
7316  case Axis::NONE:
7317  {
7318  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inArray.size();
7319  if (inShift > 0)
7320  {
7321  shift = inArray.size() - shift;
7322  }
7323 
7324  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
7325  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.begin() + shift, returnArray.end());
7326 
7327  return returnArray;
7328  }
7329  case Axis::COL:
7330  {
7331  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7332 
7333  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.cols;
7334  if (inShift > 0)
7335  {
7336  shift = inShape.cols - shift;
7337  }
7338 
7339  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
7340  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7341  {
7342  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
7343  }
7344 
7345  return returnArray;
7346  }
7347  case Axis::ROW:
7348  {
7349  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7350 
7351  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.rows;
7352  if (inShift > 0)
7353  {
7354  shift = inShape.rows - shift;
7355  }
7356 
7357  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
7358  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.cols; ++row)
7359  {
7360  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
7361  }
7362 
7363  return returnArray.transpose();
7364  }
7365  default:
7366  {
7367  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7368  // of the compiler warning.
7369  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
7370  }
7371  }
7372  }
7373 
7374  //============================================================================
7375  // Method Description:
7386  template<typename dtype>
7387  NdArray<dtype> rot90(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint8 inK) noexcept
7388  {
7389  inK %= 4;
7390  switch (inK)
7391  {
7392  case 1:
7393  {
7394  return flipud(inArray.transpose());
7395  }
7396  case 2:
7397  {
7398  return flip(inArray, Axis::NONE);
7399  }
7400  case 3:
7401  {
7402  return fliplr(inArray.transpose());
7403  }
7404  default:
7405  {
7406  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7407  // of the compiler warning.
7408  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
7409  }
7410  }
7411  }

7446  //============================================================================
7447  // Method Description:
7456  template<typename dtype>
7457  NdArray<dtype> row_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
7458  {
7459  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
7460  Shape finalShape;
7461  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
7462  {
7463  if (finalShape.isnull())
7464  {
7465  finalShape = ndarray.shape();
7466  }
7467  else if (ndarray.shape().cols != finalShape.cols)
7468  {
7469  std::string errStr = "ERROR: row_stack: input arrays must have the same number of columns.";
7470  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7471  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7472  }
7473  else
7474  {
7475  finalShape.rows += ndarray.shape().rows;
7476  }
7477  }
7478 
7479  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
7480  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
7481  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7482  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
7483  {
7484  const Shape theShape = ndarray.shape();
7485  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
7486  {
7487  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
7488  {
7489  returnArray(rowStart + row, col) = ndarray(row, col);
7490  }
7491  }
7492  rowStart += theShape.rows;
7493  }
7494 
7495  return returnArray;
7496  }

7499  // Method Description:
7511  template<typename dtype>
7512  NdArray<dtype> setdiff1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
7513  {
7514  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
7515  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
7516  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
7517 
7518  const typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_difference(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
7519  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
7520  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
7521  return NdArray<dtype>(res);
7522  }

7594  //============================================================================
7595  // Method Description:
7605  template<typename dtype>
7606  bool signbit(dtype inValue) noexcept
7607  {

8125  //============================================================================
8126  // Method Description:
8138  template<typename dtype>
8139  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double dx, Axis inAxis) noexcept
8140  {
8141  const Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
8142  switch (inAxis)
8143  {
8144  case Axis::COL:
8145  {
8146  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShape.rows, 1);
8147  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
8148  {
8149  double sum = 0;
8150  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8151  {
8152  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1) - inArray(row, col)) / 2.0 +
8153  static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col));
8154  }
8155 
8156  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
8157  }
8158 
8159  return returnArray;
8160  }
8161  case Axis::ROW:
8162  {
8163  NdArray<dtype> arrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
8164  const Shape transShape = arrayTranspose.shape();
8165  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
8166  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
8167  {
8168  double sum = 0;
8169  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8170  {
8171  sum += static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 +
8172  static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col));
8173  }
8174 
8175  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
8176  }
8177 
8178  return returnArray;
8179  }
8180  case Axis::NONE:
8181  {
8182  double sum = 0.0;
8183  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
8184  {
8185  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1] - inArray[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray[i]);
8186  }
8187 
8188  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum * dx };
8189  return returnArray;
8190  }
8191  default:
8192  {
8193  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
8194  // of the compiler warning.
8195  return NdArray<double>(0);
8196  }
8197  }
8198  }
8199 
8200  //============================================================================
8201  // Method Description:
8213  template<typename dtype>
8214  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayY, const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayX, Axis inAxis)
8215  {
8216  const Shape inShapeY = inArrayY.shape();
8217  const Shape inShapeX = inArrayX.shape();
8218 
8219  if (inShapeY != inShapeX)
8220  {
8221  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trapz: input x and y arrays should be the same shape.";
8222  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8223  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8224  }
8225 
8226  switch (inAxis)
8227  {
8228  case Axis::COL:
8229  {
8230  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShapeY.rows, 1);
8231  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeY.rows; ++row)
8232  {
8233  double sum = 0;
8234  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShapeY.cols - 1; ++col)
8235  {
8236  const double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX(row, col + 1) - inArrayX(row, col));
8237  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col + 1) - inArrayY(row, col)) / 2.0 +
8238  static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col)));
8239  }
8240 
8241  returnArray[row] = sum;
8242  }
8243 
8244  return returnArray;
8245  }
8246  case Axis::ROW:
8247  {
8248  NdArray<dtype> arrayYTranspose = inArrayY.transpose();
8249  NdArray<dtype> arrayXTranspose = inArrayX.transpose();
8250  const Shape transShape = arrayYTranspose.shape();
8251  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
8252  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
8253  {
8254  double sum = 0;
8255  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8256  {
8257  const double dx = static_cast<double>(arrayXTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayXTranspose(row, col));
8258  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayYTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 +
8259  static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col)));
8260  }
8261 
8262  returnArray[row] = sum;
8263  }
8264 
8265  return returnArray;
8266  }
8267  case Axis::NONE:
8268  {
8269  double sum = 0.0;
8270  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArrayY.size() - 1; ++i)
8271  {
8272  const double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX[i + 1] - inArrayX[i]);
8273  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i + 1] - inArrayY[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i]));
8274  }
8275 
8276  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum };
8277  return returnArray;
8278  }
8279  default:
8280  {
8281  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
8282  // of the compiler warning.
8283  return NdArray<double>(0);
8284  }
8285  }
8286  }

8288  //============================================================================
8289  // Method Description:
8301  template<typename dtype>
8302  NdArray<dtype> tril(uint32 inN, int32 inOffset) noexcept
8303  {
8304  uint32 rowStart = 0;
8305  uint32 colStart = 0;
8306  if (inOffset > 0)
8307  {
8308  colStart = inOffset;
8309  }
8310  else
8311  {
8312  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
8313  }
8314 
8315  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN);
8316  returnArray.zeros();
8317  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
8318  {
8319  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
8320  {
8321  if (col == inN)
8322  {
8323  break;
8324  }
8325 
8326  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(1);
8327  }
8328  }
8329 
8330  return returnArray;
8331  }
8332

8456  returnArray.ones();

8458  {

8460  {

8499  //============================================================================
8500  // Method Description:
8511  template<typename dtype>
8512  NdArray<dtype> trim_zeros(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const std::string inTrim)
8513  {
8514  if (inTrim == "f")
8515  {
8516  uint32 place = 0;
8517  for (auto value : inArray)
8518  {
8519  if (value != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8520  {
8521  break;
8522  }
8523  else
8524  {
8525  ++place;
8526  }
8527  }
8528 
8529  if (place == inArray.size())
8530  {
8531  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
8532  }
8533 
8534  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - place);
8535  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + place, inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
8536 
8537  return returnArray;
8538  }
8539  else if (inTrim == "b")
8540  {
8541  uint32 place = inArray.size();
8542  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8543  {
8544  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8545  {
8546  break;
8547  }
8548  else
8549  {
8550  --place;
8551  }
8552  }
8553 
8554  if (place == 0 || (place == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8555  {
8556  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
8557  }
8558 
8559  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, place);
8560  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cbegin() + place, returnArray.begin());
8561 
8562  return returnArray;
8563  }
8564  else if (inTrim == "fb")
8565  {
8566  uint32 placeBegin = 0;
8567  for (auto value : inArray)
8568  {
8569  if (value != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8570  {
8571  break;
8572  }
8573  else
8574  {
8575  ++placeBegin;
8576  }
8577  }
8578 
8579  if (placeBegin == inArray.size())
8580  {
8581  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
8582  }
8583 
8584  uint32 placeEnd = inArray.size();
8585  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8586  {
8587  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8588  {
8589  break;
8590  }
8591  else
8592  {
8593  --placeEnd;
8594  }
8595  }
8596 
8597  if (placeEnd == 0 || (placeEnd == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8598  {
8599  return NdArray<dtype>(0);
8600  }
8601 
8602  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, placeEnd - placeBegin);
8603  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + placeBegin, inArray.cbegin() + placeEnd, returnArray.begin());
8604 
8605  return returnArray;
8606  }
8607  else
8608  {
8609  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trim_zeros: trim options are 'f' = front, 'b' = back, 'fb' = front and back.";
8610  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8611  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8612  }
8613  }
8614

8656  // Method Description:
8670  template<typename dtype>
8671  NdArray<dtype> union1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
8672  {
8673  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
8674  {
8675  std::string errStr = "ERROR: union1d: input array shapes are not consistant.";
8676  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8677  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8678  }
8679 
8680  std::set<dtype> theSet(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
8681  theSet.insert(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
8682  return NdArray<dtype>(theSet);
8683  }

8722  return std::atan2(std::sin(inValue), std::cos(inValue));
8723  }
8724 
8725  //============================================================================
8726  // Method Description:
8738  template<typename dtype>
8739  NdArray<dtype> unwrap(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray) noexcept
8740  {
8741  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray.shape());
8742  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin(),
8743  [](dtype inValue) noexcept -> dtype { return unwrap(inValue); });
8744 
8745  return returnArray;
8746  }
8747 
8748  //============================================================================
8749  // Method Description:
8760  template<typename dtype>
8761  NdArray<double> var(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis) noexcept
8762  {
8763  return inArray.var(inAxis);
8764  }
8765 
8766  //============================================================================
8767  // Method Description:
8778  template<typename dtype>
8779  NdArray<dtype> vstack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
8780  {
8781  return row_stack(inArrayList);
8782  }
8783 
8784  //============================================================================
8785  // Method Description:
8797  template<typename dtype>
8798  NdArray<dtype> where(const NdArray<bool>& inMask, const NdArray<dtype>& inA, const NdArray<dtype>& inB)
8799  {
8800  const auto shapeMask = inMask.shape();
8801  const auto shapeA = inA.shape();
8802  if (shapeA != inB.shape())
8803  {
8804  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inA and inB must be the same shapes.";
8805  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8806  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8807  }
8808 
8809  if (shapeMask != shapeA)
8810  {
8811  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inMask must be the same shape as the input arrays.";
8812  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8813  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8814  }
8815 
8816  auto outArray = NdArray<dtype>(shapeMask);
8817 
8818  uint32 idx = 0;
8819  for (auto maskValue : inMask)
8820  {
8821  if (maskValue)
8822  {
8823  outArray[idx] = inA[idx];
8824  }
8825  else
8826  {
8827  outArray[idx] = inB[idx];
8828  }
8829  ++idx;
8830  }
8831 
8832  return outArray;
8833  }
8834
